levels.4: Issue stated clearly and described comprehensively with relevant context.
levels.3: Issue stated and clarified with some context and scope.
levels.2: Issue stated but description is vague or limited.

levels.4: Information interpreted/evaluated with high-quality analysis; strong support.
levels.3: Information interpreted with some analysis; generally appropriate support.
levels.2: Information taken mostly at face value; limited support.

levels.4: Thoroughly analyzes context/assumptions, including own and others'.
levels.3: Identifies and examines important assumptions and context.
levels.2: Acknowledges some assumptions; limited examination of context.
levels.1: Little to no recognition of context or assumptions.

levels.4: Specific, imaginative position that is compellingly justified.
levels.3: Clear position with logical reasoning and support.
levels.2: Position present but simplified or inconsistently supported.

levels.4: Conclusions are logical, reflect informed evaluation, and consider implications.
levels.3: Conclusions logically tied to analysis; outcomes identified.
levels.2: Conclusions simplistic or partially tied to evidence; limited outcomes.
levels.1: Conclusions not tied to evidence; outcomes oversimplified or missing.
